Labour leader Ed Miliband said: He's now done the right thing but he should have done it earlier. I think it raises real questions about David Cameron 's judgment that he hung on to Andy Coulson for so long. Andy Coulson had a stellar rise from humble beginnings, working his way through the ranks of AustralIan Edmondson-born tycoon Murdoch's British tabloid stables and becoming editor of the News of the World at just 34.

Cyber attacks against the defense department as well as American-based companies like Google were at the heart of Kirsten Gillibrand 's complaint, prompting her to write that the potentially devastating consequences to the United States illustrate the need to engage this issue at the highest levels of government. The question of China's ability to restrict exports because of their control over REEs is also a problematic one for the Senator because these regulations sometimes force companies to relocate to China in order to access the materials.

shake-up. Current Google CEO Eric Schmidt will serve as the company's executive chairman. Co-founder Sergey Brin will devote his time to strategic projects, in particular working on new products, the company said. We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time, Eric Schmidt said in a statement.`` By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company.
